Comment: American political journalism has not been very good in a long, long time.  Two things really hamstring it: 1) the belief that they need access to do the reporting and 2) the absurd need to seem unbiased.  This is why, when Republican American presidents get interviewed by UK or Irish reporters, there's often outrage on the right ([George W Bush on RTE](https://youtu.be/M35V7SniAIc?si=ue8NCtNDMGh3kB2X) comes to mind, but [that Axios interview Jonathan Swan did with Trump](https://youtu.be/yJIhxKFH9gI?si=u6s0dFD28B5rwU0s) was also a doozy).  Europe engages in a kind of adversarial journalism and will absolutely hold a politician's feet to the fire‚Äîand if they refuse to a question, the interviewer will just put words in their mouth and force them to either accept or deny them.  I'm a firm believer that the failures of American political journalism are killing us.
Author: midwinter_
